I allowed another female travel nurse to stay for a little over a week as she transitioned to a new nursing assignment. Corey inquired about the occupant because he voted the cameras and noticed her car there. I explained the situation to him, asked if I needed to provide her information and told her that she would not be there long. He told me that this would be alright. She left for a weekend then came back to finish her last shift at the hospital. After looking in the cameras and seeing her car in the driveway again, he have me an ultimatum to pay an additional $1000+ or vacate the premises in 4 days. He explained that the increase in price was to cover him for liability of she was hurt on the premises or her car was broken into (both of which should be covered by insurance). He also informed me that he was aware of our comings and goings and had dates and time stamps on his camera. I am single woman traveling in a new city so I was very concerned to learn that my every move was being watched. I was also concerned about the increase in price when I clearly paid for the entire unit and not per person. I decided to take him up on his offer and leave early. He reimbursed my money quickly and contacted Airbnb to make sure that everything was resolved appropriately. I heard of people increasing prices for Airbnb for travel nurses but I never experienced this until now. I had to make other preparations to find another place to stay (currently a hotel) which was a huge inconvenience. Most concerning to me was the constant monitoring of the cameras, the unexpected price increase for a guest staying for a week and being asked to leave after I offered to give him the information on the guest when he initially asked for it.
